intro: Tephrosia canarensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are used in traditional medicine in some regions. Tephrosia canarensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
